      • logisticFunction

        public static double logisticFunction(double x)
        The logistic function is the most common sigmoid curve. It is a function 
         
 f:[-inf,inf] -> [0,1] 
 
  1 ++----------+-----------+-----------+----------+-----------+----------++
     +           +           +           +          +  ++++++++ +           +
     |           :           :           :          ++++        :           |
     |           :           :           :        +++           :           |
 0.8 ++.........................................+++........................++
     |           :           :           :    +++   :           :           |
     |           :           :           :   ++     :           :           |
     |           :           :           :  ++      :           :           |
 0.6 ++...................................+++..............................++
     |           :           :           ++         :           :           |
     |           :           :          ++          :           :           |
     |           :           :         ++:          :           :           |
 0.4 ++..............................+++...................................++
     |           :           :      ++   :          :           :           |
     |           :           :     ++    :          :           :           |
     |           :           :   +++     :          :           :           |
 0.2 ++........................+++.........................................++
     |           :           +++         :          :           :           |
     |           :        ++++           :          :           :           |
     +           + ++++++++  +           +          +           +           +
   0 ++----------+-----------+-----------+----------+-----------+----------++
    -6          -4          -2           0          2           4           6
        Parameters:
        x - The input
        Returns:
        1/(1+exp(-x))

        Parameters:
        value - The value
        lowerBoundary - lower boundary to keep the value in
        upperBoundary - upper boundary to keep the value in
        includeUpperBoundary - whether to allow the result to equal upperBoundary or not
        Returns:
        value

      • shortestDistance

        public static double shortestDistance(double value,
                                      double lowerBoundary,
                                      double upperBoundary,
                                      boolean includeUpperBoundary)
        Calculates whether the upper boundary or the lower boundary is closer to the return value of keepInBoundaries. Method can be used to distinguish between boundary transitions assuming that the transition with a smaller distance is correct. For example: let's assume that we want to distinguish between angular state transitions. Angles are allowed to be in between [0, 360]. angle1=3 and angle2=357. What's the smallest angle between these two angles? Obviously 5. shortestDistance(357-3, 0, 180, true) will result in the desired value that is shortestDistance(357-3, 0, 180, true) = 5. Note that we pass in 180 degrees as the upper boundary i.e. distances bigger than are not allowed.
        Parameters:
        value - The value
        lowerBoundary - lower boundary to keep the value in
        upperBoundary - upper boundary to keep the value in
        includeUpperBoundary - whether to allow the result to equal upperBoundary or not
        Returns:
        shortest distance between keepInBoundaries' result and one of the boundaries
